If used as an Extended Action that takes about 1 minute, it can erase up to 10 minutes that have occurred within the last 30 minutes from the target’s memory.

name: Fur Coat
effect: The user resists all Physical Attacks one step further. Defensive.

name: Cotton Down
effect: Trigger - The user is hit by an attack\nAll Pokémon in a Burst 1 around the user have their speed lowered by 1 CS, and are Slowed for one full round.

name: Quick Cloak
effect: Burmy quickly builds a cloak out of nearby materials; using leaves and twigs will give it a Grass Plant Cloak, using sand and rocks will give it a Ground Sandy Cloak, and using trash or scrap will give it a Steel Trash Cloak. While in a Cloak, Burmy gains the Type associated with the Cloak as a secondary Typing, which will become permanent upon evolution into Wormadam. Cloaks are destroyed if Burmy is hit for Super-Effective Damage, or if Burmy makes a new Cloak. Innate.

name: Defiant
effect: Whenever the user has its Combat Stages lowered, by something other than its own Moves or Abilities, the user’s Attack is raised 2 Combat Stages.

name: Migraine
effect: Trigger - The user hits with Confusion while at 50% Hit Points or less\nConnection - Confusion. Confusion automatically gives its target the Confusion Affliction and is a Critical Hit.

name: Own Tempo
effect: The user is immune to Confusion. Defensive.

name: Fox Fire
effect: Connection - Ember. The user creates 3 Fire Wisps. Whenever the user is targeted by a foe within 6 meters, they may spend a Fire Wisp as to use the Move Ember against that foe as a Free Action after the triggering Move is resolved.

name: Flame Tongue
effect: Trigger - The user hits a foe with Lick.\nConnection - Lick. The foe hit with Lick gains an Injury and becomes Burned.

name: Wallmaster
effect: Connection - Barrier. Whenever the user uses Barrier, they may choose to either gain +2 Defense Combat Stages, or place 2 additional segments of Barrier.

name: Power Spot
effect: Allies within 2m of the user gain a +5 bonus to damage rolls.

name: Shell Shield
effect: Connection - Withdraw. The user may activate this Ability to use Withdraw as an Standard Action Interrupt and gain +10 Damage Reduction for 1 full round.

name: Pumpkingrab
effect: The user automatically Grapples an adjacent foe and gains dominance.

name: Weaponize
effect: Trigger - While being wielded as a Living Weapon and being actively commanded as a Pokémon, the user's wielder is hit by an attack that does not also target the user\nThe user becomes the target of the attack instead.

name: Wishmaster
effect: Connection - Wish. Whenever the user uses Wish, the user may pick one of the following effects: the target is healed instantly instead of the following round; or the target gains +2 CS to the Stat of their choice upon being healed; or the target is cured of any Status Affliction.

name: Ice Shield
effect: The user places up to 3 segments of Ice Wall; each segment must be continuous with another segment, and at least one must be adjacent to the user. These Ice Walls count as Blocking Terrain and last until the end of the encounter or until they are destroyed. Each Ice Wall segment is 2 meters tall, 1 meter wide, and 2 centimeters thick. Each segment has 10 Hit Points, 5 Damage Reduction, and takes damage as if it was Ice-Type.

name: Mirror Armor
effect: Trigger - A foe’s Move or Ability directly lowers the user’s CS (including effect Ranges, but not including things like Status)\nThe user’s CS are instead not lowered, and the triggering foe’s CS in the affected stats are instead lowered the same amount the user’s would have been.

name: Weird Power
effect: If the user’s Attack is higher than its Special Attack, the user may add its Attack Stat to its Special Damage Rolls. If their Special Attack is higher, they user may add its Special Attack Stat to its Physical Damage Rolls. This does not stack with Mixed Power.

name: Toxic Boost
effect: The user gains +3 Attack and Special Attack Combat Stages. Toxic Boost may only be used while Poisoned or Badly Poisoned.\nSpecial - If the user has the Immunity Ability, they can still become Poisoned and Badly Poisoned but do not lose Hit Points from these conditions.

name: Ripen
effect: Any numeric benefits of Berry Food Buffs the user trades in are doubled. (Oran Berries restore 10 HP, Liechi increases Attack by +2 CS, Jaboca causes ¼ Hit Point loss, Occa Weakens a Move 2 stages, etc.). This does not increase the number of statuses cured, Scene Moves restored, stats lowered by suppressants, or allow triggering at double the usual HP one must be at.

name: Lightning Kicks
effect: The user may activate this Ability to use any Move with “Kick” in the name as a Priority Move, and gain a +4 Bonus to the attack’s Accuracy Roll.

name: Iron Barbs
effect: Trigger - The user is hit by a damaging Melee Attack\nThe attacker loses one Tick of Hit Points.

name: Prime Fury
effect: The user becomes Enraged, and gains +1 Combat Stage in each of Attack and Special Attack.

name: Sand Stream
effect: The Weather changes to a Sandstorm for 1 full round. The user is immune to Hit Point loss from Sandstorms.

name: Power Construct
effect:
The user can only use Power Construct while below 50% HP
If the user is in 10% Forme, place a Blast 4 with the user in one of the center 4 squares. Any other creatures within the Blast are then pushed to the nearest unoccupied space outside of the Blast. The user then changes to Complete Forme until the end of the Scene, increasing its space to fill the Blast if it was placed, and gains Temporary Hit Points equal to half of the maximum hit points that Complete Forme would have. If the user would not be able to fit in the space around it at the end of this Ability, this Ability may not be used. Innate.
The user still uses the HP total and HP Maximum of the Forme that it was in (10% of 50% Forme) before entering Complete Forme. Both Formes must still follow BSR.

name: Beam Cannon
effect: The effect Range and Critical Hit Range of the user's Ranged, 1-Target Moves are increased by 3.

name: Horde Break
effect: Trigger - The user changes from School Form to Solo Form\nThe user is cured of all Status Conditions.

name: Aerilate
effect: Trigger - The User uses a Normal-Type damaging Move.\nThe Move is Changed to Flying-Type.

name: Harvest
effect: Whenever the user trades in a Food Buff from a Berry, flip a coin. On heads, the user gains all the benefits of the Food Buff, but the Buff is not used up. On tails, the Buff is consumed normally. While in Sunny Weather, the Buff is never consumed. The user may trade in a Food Buff up to once per turn during an encounter, but only until they flip “Tails”.

name: Pack Hunt
effect: Trigger - An adjacent foe is damaged by an ally's Melee attack.\nThe user may make a Physical Attack with an AC of 5 against the triggering foe. If the attack hits, the foe loses a Tick of Hit Points. Pack Hunt may not be triggered if the Pokémon is unable to act that round (including being uncommanded).

name: Frostbite
effect: The user's damaging Ice-Type attacks cause the target to become Slowed on 18+, and the Effect Range for Freeze on these Moves is increased by +1. If the Move does not cause Freezing, it now causes Freezing on a roll of 20.

name: Friend Guard
effect: Trigger - An adjacent Ally takes Damage\nThe damage is resisted one step further. Defensive.

name: Soundproof
effect: The Pokémon is immune to Moves with the Sonic Keyword. Defensive.

name: Shields Down
effect: The user has two sets of base stats; Meteor and Core. The HP of both forms must be the same. When the user is in Meteor Forme and is reduced to half Maximum HP or lower, it changes to Core Forme. The user returns to Meteor Forme while outside of combat if above half Maximum HP. Innate.

name: Teamwork
effect: While you are adjacent to an opponent, allies using Melee attacks against that opponent receive a +2 bonus to Accuracy Checks.

name: Desert Weather
effect: The user is immune to Sandstorm Damage, resists Fire-Type Moves in Sunny Weather, and gains a Tick of Temporary Hit Points at the end of each of its turns while in Rainy Weather.

name: Voodoo Doll
effect: Trigger - The user uses the Move Curse as a Ghost Type\nConnection - Curse. Choose an additional target within 8 meters of the user to become Cursed.

name: Hydration
effect: The user is cured of one Status Affliction. Hydration’s Frequency is ignored if used during Rainy Weather.

name: Crush Trap
effect: Trigger - The user successfully grapples a target.\nConnection - Wrap. When you activate this ability, the user may immediately deal damage to the target as if the user had hit with a Struggle Attack. There is no Accuracy Roll and thus this damage cannot miss, be a Critical Hit, or trigger any effect Ranges.

name: Emergency Exit
effect: When the user’s Hit Points drop below half their maximum, their trainer may immediately recall the user and send out another Pokemon as a Free Action. If the user hasn’t taken their turn yet, their replacement may act this round. Defensive. The user is immune to Trapped.

name: Cursed Body
effect: Trigger - The user is hit by a Damaging Move.\nThe Move becomes Disabled.

name: Dark Art
effect: The user gains a +5 bonus to Damage Rolls when using Dark-Type attacks. This bonus increases to +10 when the user is under 1/3rd of their Maximum Hit Points.

name: Serpent's Mark
effect:
Arbok’s Advanced and High Abilities depend on the Arbok’s hood pattern. To determine its pattern, roll 1d6 upon evolution or upon generation. If an Arbok is bred, it will have the same pattern as its parent. If both parents are Arboks with different patterns, flip a coin to decide which pattern is inherited.
Pattern name - Adv Ability / High Ability
1) Attack Pattern - Strong Jaw / Guts
2) Crush Pattern - Crush Trap / Frisk
3) Fear Pattern - Unnerve / Regal Challenge
4) Life Pattern - Regenerator / Defy Death
5) Speed Pattern - Run Away / Speed Boost
6) Stealth Pattern - Infiltrator / Ambush

name: Cruelty
effect:
Trigger - The user hits a foe with a damaging attack
After Damage is Resolved, the foe gains an Injury. The user is then informed of the total number of Injuries currently on the target, and may use that number to “purchase” the effects listed below.
»» 1 Injury: The target loses 2 Hit Points. May be “purchased” multiple times.
»» 1 Injury: The target is Slowed.
»» 2 Injuries: Until the end of the encounter, the target may not gain Hit Points or Temporary Hit Points from any source. This effect ends if the target is switched out or Takes a Breather.

name: Electric Surge
effect: The Field becomes Electrified, as if affected by the Move Electric Terrain, for one full round.

name: Sand Rush
effect: While in Sandstorming Weather or under 50% Max Hit Points, the user’s Initiative is doubled. The user is immune to Hit Point loss from Sandstorms.

name: Chemical Romance
effect: Connection - Sweet Scent. Whenever the user hits a male target with Poison Gas, Smog, Sweet Scent, Toxic, or Venom Drench, that target becomes Infatuated with the user.

name: Enduring Rage
effect: The user may not make rolls to cure themselved of the Enraged condition.  However, while Enraged, the user gains 5 Damage Reduction.

name: Color Change
effect: Trigger - The user is damaged by a Move\nThe user's Type changes to match the Type of the triggering Move.

name: Shed Skin
effect: The user is cured of one of Paralysis, Freezing, Burns, Poison, or Sleep.

name: Starswirl
effect: Connection - Rapid Spin. The user may activate this Ability to user Rapid Spin as a Swift Action.

name: Shadow Shield
effect: While at full Hit Points, the user resists all damage one step further.

name: Shield Dust
effect: The user ignores the secondary effects that trigger during Accuracy Roll of damaging Moves that target the user. For example, Flamethrower can never inflict the Burn Condition. Defensive.

name: Flavorful Aroma
effect: Trigger - The user uses Aromatic Mist\nConnection - Aromatic Mist. All allies affected by Aromatic Mist gain +1 to Accuracy Rolls and +5 to Damage Rolls for one full round.

name: Aura Break
effect: Target - A foe within 6m\nThe foe reveals its abilities. Pick one ability; any Damage Bonuses (either Damage Base increases or Damage Roll bonuses) granted by the ability instead become Damage Penalties of the same value.

name: Courage
effect: While at or under 1/3rd of its Max Hit Point value, the user gains a +5 Damage Bonus to all Damage Rolls, and 5 Damage Reduction. Defensive.

name: Unnerve
effect: Trigger - A foe within 6 meters\nThe target cannot gain positive Combat Stages or trade in Food Buffs for 1 full round.

name: Drown Out
effect: Trigger - A foe uses a Move with the Sonic keyword\nThe triggering Move fails and has no effect.

name: Tingle
effect: Trigger - The user hits an adjacent target foe with a 1-Target attack\nThe target loses a Tick of Hit Points and takes a -5 penalty to Damage Rolls for 1 full round.

name: Regenerator
effect: Trigger - The user is recalled into a Pokeball or Takes a Breather.\nThe user gains Hit Points equal to 1/3rd of its maximum Hit Points. Regenerator may be activated only once per Scene.

name: Ugly
effect: The Pokémon’s Moves Flinch Targets on a roll of 19+. If a move already has a chance of Flinching foes, The effect Range is increased by +2. During the Introduction Stage of a Contest using this Pokémon, any 6s that are rolled instead count as 1s.

name: Triage
effect: The user’s moves with the Healing keyword may be used as Priority moves.

name: Gale Wings
effect: Connection - Quick Attack. The user may use Quick Attack as a Flying-Type Move.

name: Competitive
effect: Whenever the user has its Combat Stages lowered, by something other than its own Moves or Abilities, the user’s Special Attack is raised 2 Combat Stages.

name: Punk Rock
effect: The user gains +2 DB to moves that have the Sonic keyword.  The user resists moves with the Sonic keyword one step further. Defensive.

name: Ice Face
effect: The user begins the battle with two ticks of temporary hit points. As a Standard Action in Hail, they may gain two ticks of temporary hit points. The user is immune to damage from Hail. While the user has Temporary Hit Points from this Feature, it is in Ice Face form, otherwise it is in Noice Face form. Innate.

name: Mind Mold
effect: The user gains a +5 bonus to Damage Rolls when using Psychic-Type attacks. This bonus increases to +10 when the user is under 1/3rd of their Maximum Hit Points.

name: Chilling Neigh
effect:
Trigger - The user causes a foe to Faint with a damaging attack
The user’s Attack is raised by 1 Combat Stage. In addition, all foes within 3m of the user take a -2 penalty to evasion for one full round.

name: Curious Medicine
effect:
All allies within 2m of the user have their CS reset to their default values.
Special - The user may instead trigger this as a Free Action Reaction when entering the field.

name: Dragon's Maw
effect:
Trigger - The user hits with a damaging Dragon-Type Move
One target hit by the attack becomes one stage more vulnerable to the attack (applied after all other modifiers). Immune targets are treated as initially double-resistant for the purposes of this Ability, and may be damaged normally.

name: Grim Neigh
effect:
Trigger - The user causes a foe to Faint with a damaging attack
The user’s Special Attack is raised by 1 Combat Stage. In addition, all foes within 3m of the user take a -2 penalty to Accuracy for one full round.

name: Quick Draw
effect:
Trigger - A foe uses a Move, and the user has not acted this round
The user immediately uses a Move on the triggering foe as a Standard Action Interrupt (this Move must still obey Frequency and Range). If this Move hits, the foe also gains a -2 penalty to their attack roll for the triggering attack, unless the foe cannot Flinch. The user cannot be Flinched. Defensive.

name: Splendorous Rider
effect: The user may pick a Move from their Mount’s known Moves that they do not already know. For the rest of the user’s Turn, they may use that Move as though it was one of their own Moves. Note that this does not remove any frequency limitations - a Daily Move that the Mount knows may not be used more than once. Innate.

name: Transistor
effect:
Trigger - The user hits with a damaging Electric-Type Move
One target hit by the attack becomes one stage more vulnerable to the attack (applied after all other modifiers). Immune targets are treated as initially double-resistant for the purposes of this Ability, and may be damaged normally.

name: Unseen Fist
effect: Reactions, Interrupts, and Blessings may not be activated in response to the user’s Melee Attacks.

name: Type Aura (Electric)
effect: The user and all allies within 3 meters gain a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls with Electric-Type Moves.

name: Type Aura (Fire)
effect: The user and all allies within 3 meters gain a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls with Fire-Type Moves.

name: Type Aura (Water)
effect: The user and all allies within 3 meters gain a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls with Water-Type Moves.

name: Type Aura (Grass)
effect: The user and all allies within 3 meters gain a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls with Grass-Type Moves.

name: Type Aura (Psychic)
effect: The user and all allies within 3 meters gain a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls with Psychic-Type Moves.

name: Type Aura (Dark)
effect: The user and all allies within 3 meters gain a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls with Dark-Type Moves.

name: Type Aura (Ice)
effect: The user and all allies within 3 meters gain a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls with Ice-Type Moves.

name: Type Aura (Fairy)
effect: The user and all allies within 3 meters gain a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls with Fairy-Type Moves.

name: Type Aura (Steel)
effect: The user and all allies within 3 meters gain a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls with Steel-Type Moves.

name: Type Aura (Fighting)
effect: The user and all allies within 3 meters gain a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls with Fighting-Type Moves.

name: Last Chance
effect: Last Chance Abilities are always associated with an Elemental Type. The user gains a +5 bonus to Damage Rolls when using attacks of that Type. This bonus increases to +10 when the user is under 1/3rd of their Maximum Hit Points.
